conbody.p: Select this Media sources menu item to use a sound card in teacher workstation as a source of group broadcast, allowing students to listen to a plugged in audio source during any activity.
conbody.note: Dialog Nibelung allows use of different sound cards for different groups. Moreover, different groups can listen to audio sources connected to different inputs of the same sound card.
conbody.p: The Sound card media source control tab ( ) has a drop-down list for selecting a sound card; an Open mixer button for selecting sound card inputs; a Start button; and three additional options: Record for students, Digitize and Listen (these options are described in section ).
The clock counter below the Start button displays time elapsed since the sound card has been selected as the source of broadcast.
conbody.note: The teacher can save a digitized copy of the external program for future use and/or listen to it along with the students.
conbody.p: Press Open mixer button to open Windows Sound settings window ( ) where you can select desired card input.
